laboratory_examinations.findings: Inadequate peak cortisol of 159 nmol/L despite adequate hypoglycemia.
Normal response to depot tetracosactrin (1 mg); pituitary function otherwise normal.
Demonstrated hypoperfusion of the medial temporal region, more marked on the left.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up HMPAO-SPECT scan was unchanged after 9 months of treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive for oligoclonal bands; normal total protein levels (0.2 g/L).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CSF oligoclonal bands became undetectable after 9 months of treatment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Slightly subnormal 30-min cortisol concentration at 500 nmol/L.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Two further tests showed progressive reduction in 30-min cortisol response (420, then 310 nmol/L).

laboratory_examinations.findings: Cortisol more than 1000 nmol/L, indicating central adrenal insufficiency.
Stability of the amnesic syndrome, with no progression to involve other cognitive domains.
